I don't believe there is a way to customize this today. Is the trailing slash required for something to work correctly? I think consistency is more important for SEO and redirects, right? The internet doesn't generally care whether URLs end in `/` or not.
That said, I've taken a similar approach to Trevor, creating extension methods on `WebPageUrl` for [the Kentico Community Portal](https://github.com/Kentico/community-portal/blob/v30.1.0.11/src/Kentico.Community.Portal.Web/Infrastructure/URLExtensions.cs#L12), except I remove the `~` prefix of generated URLs because those don't work outside of ASP.NET Core rendering and URL resolving.
